Bertelinus, -i m St Bettelin (dates unknown), patron of Stafford
cantalena, -ef var of cantilena [DML]
carectata, -e f var of carrettata [DML]
cestra, -e f var of chestra [DML]
episcopus, -i m bishop; ~ puerorum boy bishop, a boy, originally a choirboy in a cathedral or other collegiate church or a student in an almonry school, chosen to act as a mock bishop in liturgical and other observances on the feast of St Nicholas or of the Holy Innocents
ludus, -i m entertainment, ‘play,’ of an unspecified kind, not necessarily dramatic [see also ludus DML]
Malbanus see vicus Malbanus
Michaelis, -e adj of or pertaining to St Michael, see also terminus
nundine, -arum f pl market-day, fair-day
parcellum, -i n var of parcella [DML]
parochialis, -e adj of or pertaining to a parish
promotus, -a, -um pfp pass promoted, used of a proceeding against a person in a church court moved or initiated by someone other than the court itself or a person authorized to make presentment
terminus, -i m term, here a law term; ~ Michaelis Michaelmas term
vicus, -i m settlement, borough, village, etc; ~ Malbanus Nantwich, Cheshire
ystrio, -onis m in CL, an actor; sense widening in ML, here an entertainer, or performer of some kind unspecified [see histrio DML, OLD]
